title: Secondary – Cycle 2 – Progression of Learning - Music (2010)
subject: Arts Education

document.title: Secondary – Cycle 2 – Progression of Learning - Music (2010)

9176428DD8E542439C389BE12D19AAA1.description: Identifies elements that contributed to the development of the appreciation and that he/she could apply in a subsequent project, (e.g. use of different information sources, recording methods)

415E12877B6640FEBFEA2C2BD81322C8.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the appreciation dynamic and to the strategies used (e.g. ability to identify expressive elements, strategies related to observation)

B163114603F943CFAA1FFDD4DA6D917F.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the appreciation dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. use of different techniques for auditory discrimination)

4AB49816700547C695E8C5CCE0741278.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with prescribed terminology in each of the programs

86ABCDDC49EB473EB1C20CDCAFC0E8C9.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

F1E5BB42B6604C65B12F4E260B60D030.description: Justifies his/her point of view with arguments based on the content of the work, the meaning perceived and the appreciation criteria selected

F174FDC6E2A64DAC917783B3A18BE01F.description: Justifies his/her point of view with arguments based on connections between the different elements selected

091FA7FECB114D7A810B69BDD4EB62AF.description: Expresses his/her preferences concerning his/her observations through the application of previously acquired appreciation criteria

0AE1A4469BED496F89628FCC0A64FB00.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology for in each of the programs

C11977BE41A84CB8B25BF315CC11E8D3.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

8A3066873FAA457F979606A69CA84BB2.description: Makes connections between the musical effects observed, the meaning perceived and the symbolism of the work (e.g. certain elements of musical language and structure that suggest a treatment of the work in terms of meaning and desired effects)

33631DEC81A94BFE9A04B74D35816CF1.description: Makes connections between the musical effects observed, the meaning perceived and the expressive elements of the work (e.g. descending series of tones to represent a dramatic moment)

33FCA035455F42B299216E8B012D21E5.description: Makes connections between the musical elements observed and the meaning perceived (e.g. choice of tempo adapted to the emotion or the desired musical atmosphere)

71ACD544756641A1A1EFFC350AC9CA5D.description: Interprets the meaning of the work or production

A36C7584C5F54AF1933150104CBE441B.description: Describes the use of certain elements of structure and relates these to the meaning of the multimedia work (e.g. sound clusters with feedback electronic effects or reverberation to enhance the expressive character of the work)

D7D1A89A59E04AB5818AEF7B777D85FD.description: Describes the use of certain elements of structure and relates these to the meaning of the work (e.g. changes of key associated with a change of mood)

464F15641F124CE3AD22946EFCBEF978.description: Describes the function of different structural elements of the work

AB43999D79594B5D8F7F4A5C47BC338F.description: Identifies the structural elements of the work (e.g. ABA form, allegro, accelerando, etc.)

3A5B03599EAA454888273453B7F43B19.description: Picks out the similarities and contrasts in certain passages associated with the structural elements of the work (e.g. form, tempo, rhythmic, melodic and harmonic organization)

6A0C55410D5A464E91C2104E1359A5D9.description: Identifies particular aspects of the compositional procedures used in a multimedia work (e.g. ostinato represented with one of the signal modifications, digital collage)

5C4E0943BC384215AF8F53CFB4790F42.description: Identifies particular aspects of the compositional procedures used in the work (e.g. the effect of dynamics, varieties of tempi in the reproduction of sound, repetition or collage)

0D3B5669830143E7A87627B8CCCF63E0.description: Describes ways of using compositional procedures in the work (e.g. contrast of tempo, dynamics, duration in reproduction of sound, repetition or collage)

352759673D654C5A9DD3EF1C5B6C9344.description: Identifies different ways of using compositional procedures in the work (e.g. changes of register in the reproduction of sound)

EB7A8C28AC824FEB976520424A1671F2.description: Picks out similarities and contrasts with the compositional procedures used in the work (e.g. reproduction of sound, repetition, collage)

344319F2126F42079772FA87B5A3D5BF.description: Describes particular aspects of the vocal or instrumental performance, media, tools or techniques that characterize a multimedia work (e.g. distinction between natural voice and processed voice)

7E1554034BB04E9D8C4308936E89DF2C.description: Describes particular aspects of the vocal or instrumental performance that characterize the work (e.g. different techniques for playing the same instrument)

26FC8E84B22247B593EE975F1712DEFC.description: Describes ways of using sound sources and techniques in the work (e.g. use of the bow for bowed strings)

A2C71B437F7D412D9378F17C9BE963EF.description: Picks out different ways of using sound sources and techniques in the work (e.g. plucked strings, bowed strings)

3D735BE1385246F1B7349DF495B40F89.description: Identifies sound sources and techniques used in the work (e.g. voice, strings, winds, playing techniques)

2F814ACA01684BFAB9FF502F795CBA29.description: Describes elements of musical language that are particularly characteristic of the multimedia work (e.g. variation of duration and pitch through treatment of the sound)

D09A72A1E33B4900B128FBD836F4D620.description: Describes elements of musical language that are particularly characteristic of the work (e.g. identification of sounds of the chromatic scale)

3E9597EC573D412EBF83F74603B5A9AC.description: Describes ways of using elements of musical language in the work (e.g. changing dynamics by repeating a rhythmic or melodic motif)

3FA8A12D47D64E08A228408EF11069E0.description: Identifies different ways of using elements of musical language in the work (e.g. changes in tempo)

F231FC2223C34A6393AF1641FBE94448.description: Picks out similarities and contrasts associated with elements of musical language used in the work (e.g. dynamics, duration, pitch)

30E9DA2FC5234AC29912E50D7A46A9CE.description: Places in context elements of multimedia content in the work that have symbolic significance (e.g. choice of a particular tone colour, type of instrument used, treatment of the work in terms of meaning or effects attempted)

80147C21D4D84494886A2DD239B7AAD2.description: Picks out elements of content related to the performance of the work (e.g. dynamics and tempo associated with the musical performance)

F7107A60EF6745FB946758F21329EC7B.description: Places in context elements of content in the work that have symbolic significance (e.g. form, culture-specific sound sources )

75653F21E9944B71A344167942B0D80C.description: Makes connections between elements of content identified and historical and sociocultural aspects of the work (e.g. elements of structure, sound sources associated with the folk music of a country)

31AD9B1F1B4640CAB398DE8245BCFB9D.description: Picks out component elements of the work (e.g. sound sources, elements of musical language, structure)

263275A864264A95846D694D824F1C38.description: Applications of Knowledge: Competency 3 – Appreciates musical works

2921886D5A274182AC71E470BE457D0C.description: Identifies elements that he/she could apply in a subsequent project, focusing on his/her choice of strategies and the conventions and context of the work being performed

142AC92BB68B4BF0ABEEC2EBAC7A5682.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the performance dynamic and to the strategies used (e.g. ways of becoming familiar with elements of technique, ways of cooperating in ensemble work)

6F0A679F76264DD0A3468CD2B74490D3.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the performance dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. procedures for decoding musical scores)

22D25EE1734F457FBACEC6B851D9E19F.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology in each of the programs

1341845DF58349CEB938FE3D0273E85E.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

538C7797D1E9467D85472754F2F3FC3C.description: Incorporates a combination of sound and visual cues into his/her musical performance (e.g. takes into account the sound or visual beat and dynamics on the screen)

7BB41BC5265F4537BC96CF5618BD3127.description: Incorporates a combination of sound and visual cues into his/her musical performance

5A4B72ED2123442FA1B5CA894231C252.description: Adjusts his/her musical performance to certain sound and visual cues

886CA42547BE44D5B5D5A8C6A8011713.description: Applies sound and visual cues for ensemble music in his/her musical performance (e.g. phrasing and balance between the parts)

C8F71D0DF2064ABB875B46B9B6EF6AD2.description: Responds to sound or visual cues related to the work in ensemble playing (e.g. changes in tempo)

4F8CE485FFCC4BB9B5F87A8A639C7381.description: Respects the conventions for group ensemble work

804FE095BF3C45889832FBF73726DF57.description: Incorporates various techniques related to the expressive character of the multimedia work into his/her musical performance (e.g. use of various techniques in order to produce electronic effects)

8755F9ACF1224031A723F288897082B8.description: Incorporates various techniques related to the expressive character of the work into his/her musical performance (e.g. use of special techniques in order to produce acoustic effects)

F9AEBA5C9AA64DF0A98E148E829319B7.description: Adjusts his/her musical performance to certain expressive passages in the work (e.g. simultaneous changes in dynamics and tempo in relation to the expression required)

50EE15362B214C3BA545144930ACF4FA.description: Highlights out the expressive elements of the piece in his/her performance (e.g. changes in tempo according to the required expression)

E9BC718800544768B264C8A9F4F1103B.description: Applies elements related to the expressive character of the piece (e.g. use of the dynamics indicated in the piece)

6343D17C3BA544E1B0543EB88DD4AF9A.description: Becomes familiar with the expressive nature of the piece of music

1A7807467C5948429A580F501C4CB004.description: Incorporates different elements of vocal, instrumental and multimedia techniques

4C5F92EF520C4E92A0E46808FBC14221.description: Incorporates different elements of technique into his/her musical performance, depending on the complexity of the work

40EBDA4322DC4E07951CBD8637D2FEE5.description: Applies the appropriate techniques for executing a musical passage

F6F7876C009A41CDAA3C61F52B196C2A.description: Combines elements of technique in a short piece (e.g. intonation, projection) taking into account the structure of the work

AE9ACBE28A6741C4ABBCE77FF3D8AD2E.description: Applies the elements of technique required in musical phrases (e.g. posture, breathing, articulation) taking into account the structure of the work

99AB49318C4E4E24B06187C9F34552B2.description: Plays musical phrases with the voice, a musical instrument or a technological sound source, emphasizing the nuances of musical language in the multimedia work

F926693626F0439682D31B8A4585DB6F.description: Plays musical phrases, emphasizing the nuances of musical language in the work

99D83A2399444BC186A7E077DAB6ABF8.description: Plays musical phrases all the way through, taking into account the sound source used

C1820613E19A48269941CB21D156C61F.description: Executes musical phrases, taking into account sound source used (e.g. voice, strings, winds, percussion, body percussion, information and communications technologies)

D4460A43F93041D69E4BCAB5CAA32056.description: Picks out historical and sociocultural aspects to be considered in the performance dynamic

8E1FB1512B7743E2BE87C72F34377882.description: Incorporates structural elements in his/her musical performance, making use of memorization strategies

E34A3CCF5B224A09A8876D6399307FFB.description: Reads the work all the way through, observing different structural elements

E549A683DC32403490609F756F64E84A.description: Reads the phrasing within a musical work, taking into account different elements of structure (e.g. repeat signs, tempi, simple measures, key signature)

09960019025C49DCBB127CC844FB9316.description: Decodes elements of structure in a musical work (e.g. form, repeat signs, change of tempo, simple rhythmic units, musical phrase, major and minor chords)

79CE63A36B814CC2A965FCBBEE32CD69.description: Incorporates elements of musical language into his/her performance, making use of memorization strategies

D00F5527223D451398C4688F6C7338B3.description: Reads the work all the way through, observing different elements of musical language

B6E0828EA5CD4AEF9163F48D94D44754.description: Reads the phrases of a proposed work, taking into account different elements of musical language (e.g. dynamics, note and rest signs)

91ADBBFE86024CA3BA825B0C1EF10FC3.description: Decodes elements of musical language in the proposed work, using reading strategies

698E3B957C024EA6BA0A1E17B9B33F3D.description: Becomes familiar with the musical content of the work

F97D852AA6314DBEA4E7EBDC088632CA.description: Applications of Knowledge: Competency 2 – Performs musical works

76EB9196F3484750A3C32B59854ABBA6.description: Picks out elements that he/she could apply in a subsequent project, focusing on the relevance of his/her choices, the strategies used, the respect of conventions and the context of the creative production

4F4FDEFE163A4AF0B0FA40976D8E5DB5.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the creative dynamic and to the strategies used (e.g. use of three phases of the creative dynamic, techniques for auditory discrimination)

CE354DD746E5402F8F662A82F5AD97A7.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the creative dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. memorization strategies)

ADDD3615B6674863AD244EA7ABDF8AB4.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology prescribed for in each the programs

4DBD519C1750466B847AC6B6284E54A6.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

203BEB9137D34DA8BE73DB6A47832A8D.description: Highlights different elements of structure in his/her creation (e.g. use of the ABA form with contrasting tempi and modulation)

C436E6F6B5794F0C96464733CC3A059D.description: Applies different elements of structure adapted to his/her creation (e.g. use of theme and variations with changes of tempo)

440C7F37234F4453BD308C8DED8F423A.description: Selects elements of structure adapted to his/her creation (e.g. use of simple rhythmic units in a rondo)

D976249EE95C4059834258A79D588570.description: Tries out elements of structure adapted to his/her creation (e.g. use of a musical form and a tempo)

CD5718D7A63D4DC986E1DA9B6ABC21EB.description: Develops a sequence that highlights the compositional procedure that best represents his/her multimedia production (e.g. use of collage in an animated film)

5834159E405E4742B5FC4A11BDFA9195.description: Develops a sequence that highlights the compositional procedure that best represents his/her creative intention (e.g. use of dynamics and pitch in contrast)

91939B743F194846877C1B57C94CD038.description: Constructs a musical idea using a specific compositional procedure

06C82FD767C8429ABADC0FAA1A008B0F.description: Plays sequences using different compositional procedures (e.g. reproduction of sound and collage)

AEACF8005A16451581DAB263050CC14D.description: Plays short sequences using a specific compositional procedure (e.g. contrast, repetition)

F739A70687924EC7AFCB2DAD12E4044D.description: Uses vocal, instrumental and multimedia techniques in a variety of ways

4CB6D277421F4237B7FF02BF38FF2F2E.description: Uses sound sources and techniques in a personal way

DB647502AD2D4E3F8C762F13F432D6D3.description: Highlights the different sound sources and techniques used in his/her creation (e.g. sound effects used in his/her musical performance)

306CE90E6F4642239D75534A26C6F737.description: Selects various sound sources for his/her creation (e.g. different techniques)

0D166D8A1D814A1EA73080C0DF506C61.description: Looks for a variety of tones among the sound sources, making use of his/her memory and playing short improvisations (e.g. using mallets made of wood, metal, felt or other materials)

B6F5EB96CD0C4BA9857786843C2CF0CC.description: Uses different elements of musical language within a sound production with graphic representation or a mixed or multimedia production

89DA628D95AC42A492BDC759BEF9962D.description: Uses different elements of musical language within a sound production with graphic representation or a mixed production

2BE485BEAB104CD091594BEBF60D5A7F.description: Tries out different elements of musical language adapted to the development of a sound production with graphic representation or a mixed production

AF11870F3C7D4B0DB1B53637E7999E48.description: Tries out different elements of musical language adapted to the development of a sound production with graphic representation

59FF42279D054CD79B5800255A2A728D.description: Tries out different elements of musical language in short melodic or rhythmic improvisations

310985E9114C45769C94BEA03F49B503.description: Uses sound sources, elements of musical language and elements of musical technique

A3D65E5B30AB478EB01EAC7B8FFA2B40.description: Tries out and selects musical ideas adapted to a composition, an improvisation or an arrangement , according to the suggested media or multimedia tools(e.g. computer, synthesizer, video camera)

F416028DFEDF4E54876A9F427A620B9E.description: Tries out and selects musical ideas adapted to a composition, an improvisation or an arrangement , according to the suggested instrumentation(e.g. compositional procedures, musical language, structure)

AC20909ABF5A466194B1C08186275D12.description: Tries out ideas related to musical content adapted to an improvisation or an arrangement (e.g. compositional procedures, musical language, sound sources)

B19B94A42ECF4F1E966D5A3C2E1256A5.description: Tries out ideas related to musical content adapted to an improvisation or a composition (e.g. sound sources, techniques, structure)

D905D9F797274956B1122AA977788627.description: Finds ideas related to the language, rules and tools of music that emerge from the stimulus for creation (e.g. compositional procedures, sound sources, musical language)

E509D3A6E86847B59E132D255928398C.description: Uses ideas to create a musical work

1EDA4D2AC0074209B21A7B94B937C04D.description: Applications of Knowledge: Competency 1 – Creates musical works

5761BD901D5A44AFBC916CC03F73E76E.description: Names works and artists associated with multimedia

77D8E8A2E4A24F9A8E6FF21C0B974C83.description: Describes cultural references (e.g. cultural experiences) associated with works from the musical repertoire of Québec and the repertoire of other cultures

0F2A4CB414D44AE58C84149D52DCF0A8.description: Names works or composers from different artistic periods including the Impressionist, Expressionist, Neo-classical, Romantic, Classical, and Baroque periods, the Renaissance and the Middle Ages

B453ACD9B94B4D7981073F5DD721F01D.description: Associates cultural references (e.g. composers, sociocultural context) with works from the Québec repertoire and the repertoire of other cultures

9392902FFA8F43E78C60C7E6D70C30E2.description: Associates works with artistic periods or styles

4FD6601E386E47158F58E515A86266DE.description: Identifies artistic periods, styles of works and cultural references (e.g. elements of the history of music)

1D1FAF3BACFC4C968959488599856B34.description: Identifies works from the musical repertoire of Québec and the repertoire of other cultures

5C3BB30EA5B74658A5680E0052245967.description: Names artistic periods (e.g. contemporary, classical, baroque) and styles of works (e.g. popular, chansonnier, blues, jazz)

F8C22A43DBE54790BD0FD679F48CD237.description: Musical repertoire and cultural references for appreciation

E1BBBE3DA74148018AFF8C88C8214506.description: Compares the characteristics of certain graphic symbols in a piece of music

91579CCFB8D745669FFDADDB2CA5C789.description: Describes the characteristics of certain graphic symbols related to musical language and to the structure of a piece of music

259B18F078BE48E98C3257D05ABC2244.description: Differentiates certain graphic symbols related to musical language and to the structure of a piece of music

7BEFA2C4EE9249FB8C2AF99A18BC6084.description: Identifies graphic symbols (personal codes) related to musical language and to the structure of a piece of music

D74D94FDF4AA4A3FBEB19F24ADF3D90E.description: Compares elements of harmonic organization (e.g. different tones)

864AD9F97C764F318F63F31129831323.description: Describes characteristics of certain elements of harmonic organization(e.g. a cluster is a group of simultaneous conjunct sounds)

5F5667E1A64440EFA3BE2E8E83356B11.description: Picks out certain elements of harmonic organization, especially major and minor chords

0D2D8A45683A454BBF868018B9B5AFF1.description: Names the following elements of harmonic organization: tone cluster, cluster, major and minor

45921585CCCC4134ABA992E8552C6C78.description: Compares elements of melodic organization (e.g. different simple intervals)

DB6307DD3C5947ADAD69C4DCC0D47BE8.description: Describes the characteristics of certain elements of melodic organization (e.g. description of a major scale)

BBAD0B2F2DF54683B542C907A42968C3.description: Picks out elements of melodic organization (e.g. sequences of ascending and descending chromatic and diatonic sounds)

375A02E823A14B8BB63B00C539668870.description: Identifies elements of melodic organization (e.g. musical phrase, ascending and descending series of sounds, conjunct sounds, disjunct sounds, series of sounds repeated at a fixed pitch, glissando)

FAA0DDF2EF5B4D6AA43D224F10CF73F9.description: Compares the characteristics of certain elements of rhythmic organization, especially syncopation and compound metre

25301DE90B294255B439B658DDE83987.description: Describes the characteristics of certain elements of rhythmic organization

BCC8F1E3F2EF441BB43EFD8303D4F0AF.description: Points out elements of rhythmic organization, especially simple duple and triple metres

D85624D3A95A4C698DF13345AF33DF38.description: Identifies different elements of rhythmic organization (e.g. beat, measures, simple rhythmic units)

2EFCB7ADA3A1414F847E0BC200E39F8F.description: Compares subtleties of tempi, referring to their characteristics

A9A960136E9F40798262B036735D8D48.description: Describes the characteristics of different tempi

B2A9DEAC8DA14785B2D7E69A5DF6967A.description: Differentiates the terms pertaining to tempi

D06A16F708A54A489D3737A71FE66C35.description: Identifies tempi among the following: lento, moderato, allegro, accelerando, rallentando, change of tempo, ad libidum, a tempo, ritenuto

D69D09B865CD4BC5955645D5CA7FB66C.description: Compares different musical forms referring to their components

F4F8A0441A54466F8031406AF84BE3EF.description: Describes the components of a musical form

24044AA5EF8247959C782EBA3D5ED030.description: Differentiates forms and repeat signs, especially the canon, rondo, theme and variations

22619EC99ECB4ECD9EFFE99CF8F898E8.description: Identifies repeat signs and musical forms from among the following: individual, AB form, ABA form, canon in two voices, rondo, canon, theme and variations

5FFB80822DD14E4A9D6E87D318847ED7.description: Compares the different qualities of sound and articulation signs that have undergone digital or analog processing

83547D8C1A794D40A9B61C207EF93047.description: Compares different qualities of sound and articulation signs

8AEA6BB521604D259C2C26DE5BCAA05D.description: Describes characteristics of qualities of sound and articulation signs

DAC555FA8C174D888B3309E8BE352A6C.description: Highlights qualities of sound and articulation signs (e.g. staccato, legato, accent, sforzando, appoggiatura, mordent)

E9DC0CEE60D34B4CB3764CF97C0E0924.description: Identifies qualities of sound and articulation signs (e.g. staccato, legato, accent, sforzando)

45A8CED753AF4C29BD3A7DF76C6363AC.description: Compares the specific methods of producing sounds from the voice and from different families of instruments with those that have undergone digital or analog processing (e.g. digital synthesizer, sampler)

B402BD7DBB354DE3B517B2D345D86399.description: Compares the specific methods of producing sounds from the voice and from different families of instruments

1D515CAD91AD4883AD929404CD23D979.description: Describes different ways of producing a sound (e.g. vibration of a column of air, strings, percussions, digital sounds)

063367065F984F859DE9BC43E4252A6C.description: Highlights characteristics of instruments and the families they belong to, as well as registers of the voice

2E2C0A5CFDDD4735B6599B3F57AD2909.description: Identifies instruments and the families they belong to, as well as registers of the voice (soprano, alto, tenor, bass)

CE83A0D0AC4D4D26A5C23DD6D5DAB4B3.description: Compares the characteristics of different registers, pitches of the diatonic scale, including the chromatic scale, transposition by one octave higher or lower, and double sharps and flats that have undergone digital or analog processing

0FF665A5B143487381F72960CBEEA7C7.description: Compares the characteristics of different registers, pitches of the diatonic scale, including the chromatic scale, transposition by one octave higher or lower, and double sharps and flats

3E64279AEF0242A1A13BE0FD51590AE3.description: Describes the characteristics of different registers, pitches of the diatonic scale, including the chromatic scale and various accidental signs

D98CAB209B5A4372BE6A2C6290431AA1.description: Differentiates registers, pitches of the diatonic scale, including the chromatic scale and accidental signs

B60E032BE91841119AD51B567FBAE835.description: Identifies registers, pitches of the diatonic scale, notes on the staff and ledger lines in different keys, according to the instrument played, as well as accidental signs (sharp, flat, natural) and key signatures

97F6892B1D6F41D98A08859459392A4D.description: Compares the characteristics of certain note and rest figures, and augmentation signs that have undergone digital or analog processing

70150861500C410FB5DE817498F887FD.description: Compares the characteristics of certain note and rest figures, and augmentation signs

7EC982A65D8749B6901EE2297DB273DF.description: Describes the characteristics of certain note and rest figures, and augmentation signs

396380164A95491AA091D839173EB449.description: Differentiates certain note and rest figures, and augmentation signs

396DD08CBE35461E9B7C31FF13D2E00C.description: Identifies symbols for notes, rests, and augmentation signs among the following: whole note, half note, quarter note, quarter rest, two eighth notes, eighth note, sixteenth note, whole rest, half rest, eighth rest, dotted note, dotted rest, tie, fermata

D6C95DE8E10D49BA808CED4D89E5E299.description: Identifies and compares the subtleties of certain dynamics that have undergone digital or analog processing

431BA37413DD4BD986AAC4B80E59F4C7.description: Identifies and compares the subtleties of certain dynamics (e.g. between pianissimo and piano, between forte and mezzo forte)

03A2E2DCFBCB4B0FB5ABDC86BB6E05CD.description: Identifies the characteristics of certain dynamics

D6A1EFB92B894859B8D6018032B95CB7.description: Identifies some dynamics among the following: forte, piano, crescendo, decrescendo, pianissimo, fortissimo, mezzo piano, mezzo forte, subito piano
